allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.publicNotes: Once a creature representative of eternal life, the lifeless flame comes instead to devour all life around it. It croaks and screeches with a dank and grimy cough, its once fiery red and vibrant orange luster given over to pale whites, sooty grays and pitch blacks. The veil itself is imperfect; its body is covered in dusty cracks from head to toe and across the span of its brittle and molting wings. Its eyes are no longer there; from its Ashen Cloak and visage, there are only open pot-holes cauldron black that peer with a hateful void. Even when the Ashen Cloak dissipates, the smoke is alive like a coughing fit and massing cloud with only a vaguely avian head screeching with pain and woe.
details.privateNotes:
Lifeless Flames go by several names in different regions. Sometimes referred to as “fauxnix”, these fallen phoenixes come into being when their ceremonial rebirth cycle is disrupted. Their self-resurrection can be tampered during the very moments of its conception if the phoenix was killed in a desecrated place or area touched with the dread and rot of undeath. Duress in their final moments, deep suffering, or a fatal betrayal by a close friend can sometimes burn away at what is in actuality a fragile core and soul.

 

The phoenix thus becomes distorted or a mere vestige of their former undying life. Their fires burned away, all that is left is a body of ash and smoke that drowns in its own suffering and seeks to lash out at every living creature around it. In this form, as a lifeless flame, a phoenix can be destroyed permanently, having lost its abilities to relight its flame in the eternal cycle of rebirth. There however is another way.

 

The flames of rebirth can be rekindled. Player characters can choose to take on a quest to restore a lifeless flame to its true form as a phoenix in various ways.

 

  • An elder phoenix can aid in the rebirth of the lifeless flame by sharing its essence. Lifeless flames are considered tragic aberrations which are no fault of their own, and being good creatures, another phoenix might consider offering its aid. For a young phoenix, this comes with its own dangers, as the lifeless flame could potentially snuff out another eternal life.

  • An artifact of fire or life granted to the lifeless flame with a display of monumental good, love, or truth can possibly restore them. At the GM’s discretion, this can destroy or render the artifact unusable for an extended period, such as a year.

  • The sacrifice of a pure life or soul, or the relinquish of a divine spark or fated power.

 

Lifeless flames can sometimes mirror or parody some of their previous aspects in life, or they awaken to new and terrible powers bestowed in their own despair, hatred, or undeathly descent. The lifeless flame gains access to one of the following abilities; an elite or higher level lifeless flame gains access to two of the following abilities.

 

  • Choking Ash Ash and smoke shroud the lifeless flame. Creatures within 20 feet of the lifeless flame must make a DC 34 basic Fortitude save or take 2d6 fire and 2d6 negative energy damage. Creatures that fail the save become sickened 1.

  • Predatory Smoke The lifeless flame’s talons Strike gains the Improved Grab ability. It can Interact with and Grab creatures and items even while it is incorporeal. Any creature still grabbed by the lifeless flame at the end of their turn must make a saving throw against the lifeless flame’s Drain Life ability.

  • Putrid Strike A terrible black and sooty fire can be born from a lifeless flame’s core. The lifeless flame can cast flame strike as a 8th-level divine spell three times a day; it instead deals half its damage as fire and half its damage as negative.

  • Summon Wraiths [three-actions] (conjuration, divine) A lifeless flame’s nature can beckon some of the most foul undead. Once per day, it can conjure two dread wraiths within 30 feet. These dread wraiths cannot create spawn and lose the draining presence ability. If this ability is chosen by an elite lifeless flame, this ability conjures two elite dread wraiths with the same restrictions. These conjured wraiths take their turns after the lifeless flame.

description.value: The lifeless flame can see through ash clouds and smoke, ignoring @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} or the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} condition of creatures inside.

Lifeless flames are envious of the sun and rebuke from its wholesome light. Lifeless flames caught in sunlight are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If a lifeless flame is wearing its Ashen Cloak, it ignores this effect.

At the start of the day, the smoky and wispy form of the lifeless flame dons ash as a second skin. This increases the lifeless flame’s AC to 37 and grants it 100 temporary Hit Points, and it loses the incorporeal trait. While wearing its Ashen Cloak, the lifeless flame can choose for its beak and talon Strikes to instead deal piercing and slashing damage respectively. Its Strength modifier becomes +5 while it wears its Ashen Cloak. It loses its immunity to precision damage and all of its resistances. As a single action with the manipulate trait, the lifeless flame can shed its ash cover to become an incorporeal and smoky vestige once more, removing any remaining temporary Hit Points granted by its Ashen Cloak.

When the lifeless flame damages a living creature with its beak or talon Strikes, it gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Temporary Hit Points gained with this ability add cumulatively to the amount granted by the lifeless flame's Ashen Cloak, if it is still wearing it. Further damage dealt by the lifeless flame's beak and talon Strikes increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

target.value: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

description.value:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 The spell has a range of touch.

2 (concentrate) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (concentrate) You disperse void energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

target.value: 1 living creature or 1 willing undead creature

description.value:
You summon a tumultuous cloud of ash and smoke. The cloud is difficult terrain for flying creatures, and creatures in the cloud can't detect anything using their sense of smell. Creatures that start their turn within the cloud take 2d4 fire damage as their lungs fill with the hot, acrid smoke, with a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

target.value: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

description.value:
You create a cloud of putrid mist in the area. The cloud functions as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist} except it sickens creatures that end their turns within the cloud. (The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition is not a poison effect.)

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while in the cloud.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it leaves the cloud.

You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

Heightened (3rd) The range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 120 feet.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

Your gaze pierces through illusions and finds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and spirits. You can see invisible creatures as though they weren't invisible, although their features are blurred, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and difficult to identify. You can also see incorporeal creatures, like ghosts, phased through an object from within 10 feet of an object's surface as blurry shapes seen through those objects. Subtler clues also grant you a +2 status bonus to checks you make to disbelieve illusions.

Heightened (5th) This spell has a duration of 8 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{Spell Effect: See the Unseen}
